subject: Help w/"JUnit Best Practices" Program from JavaWorld
msgSnippet: Hi, The December, 2000 edition of JavaWorld featured an article on JUnit Best Practices (http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-12-2000/jw-1221-junit.html).
messageBody:
Hi,

The December, 2000 edition of JavaWorld featured an article on
JUnit Best Practices
(http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-12-2000/jw-1221-junit.html).
This article includes a program that builds a JUnit test case for an
entire system.

I've tried running this program using the instructions in the article
but I get the message: "Cannot load class that NameOfMyClass is
dependent on" for all of my classes. Some of the classes should not
be loaded because they are not valid test cases. But there are some
classes that should be loaded and I am puzzled as to why the program
will not load them.

My valid test classes contain the required line:
public static final String TEST_ALL_TEST_TYPE = "UNIT";

Any suggestions would be much appreciated.

Judy
